subsection_content:
Clinical manifestations usually go through 3 periods:
Adult worms parasitize in the intestine: the patient shows signs of digestive disorders such as abdominal pain and diarrhea for 1-2 days.; Larvae move in the muscles: the patient has high fever, rapid weakness, and pain in the muscles and joints. Difficulty chewing, difficulty swallowing, difficulty breathing. There is edema in the face and eyelids; Cystic larvae: the patient is very exhausted, itchy, feels like crawling, insomnia, sweating, face is swollen, skin has petechiae.; If the infection is mild, the disease may gradually subside, fever will decrease, and swelling will go away, but muscle pain may still exist. If severely infected, symptoms of muscle pain, respiratory paralysis, and severe weakness can lead to death
subsection_title: giun xoan.json. Symptoms of trichinosis infection
subsection_data:
giun xoan.json. Symptoms of trichinosis infection
Clinical manifestations usually go through 3 periods:
Adult worms parasitize in the intestine: the patient shows signs of digestive disorders such as abdominal pain and diarrhea for 1-2 days.; Larvae move in the muscles: the patient has high fever, rapid weakness, and pain in the muscles and joints. Difficulty chewing, difficulty swallowing, difficulty breathing. There is edema in the face and eyelids; Cystic larvae: the patient is very exhausted, itchy, feels like crawling, insomnia, sweating, face is swollen, skin has petechiae.; If the infection is mild, the disease may gradually subside, fever will decrease, and swelling will go away, but muscle pain may still exist. If severely infected, symptoms of muscle pain, respiratory paralysis, and severe weakness can lead to death
